intro: Spermacoce savannarum, commonly known as the African catchfly, is a flowering plant native to sub-Saharan Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and savannas. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Spermacoce savannarum is an annual herb that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous tiny seeds.
